文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: Trace elements can reduce the fracture resistance of Zr-2.5Nb pressure tubes.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: Hydrogen is present in the zirconium sponge as water, can be absorbed at each stage of tube fabrication, and needs to be carefully controlled, particularly during ingot breakdown and subsequent forging.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: Hydrogen concentrations in finished tubes have been reduced by a factor of three through the optimization of manufacturing processes and the implementation of new technology.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: The fracture toughness of cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb is very variable and remains so after irradiation [1,2].

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: For example, dJ/da at 240°C varied between 20 and 150 MPa after a neutron fluence of about 6.5×10²⁵ n/m²

证据片段: A low fracture toughness corresponds with the small spacing and large size of the fissures

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: The fracture surface of material containing little chlorine had no fissures, and the fracture toughness was very high.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk1
证据片段: Hydrogen has been responsible for cracking in CANDU6 pressure tubes [4].

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk2
证据片段: Zr-2.5Nb pressure tubes manufactured before 1992 had a specified maximum concentration of $1 1 . 4 ~ \mathsf { p p m }$ (at) [150 ppm (wt)] carbon, with typical concentrations ranging from 6.1 to $1 1 . 4 ~ \mathsf { p p m }$ (at) [80 to 150 ppm (wt)].

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk3
证据片段: a new specification limit of 9.5 ppm (at) [125 ppm (wt)] carbon has been introduced

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_016_chunk3
证据片段: Typical carbon concentrations of recently manufactured pressure tubes have been in the range of 6.8 to 8.3 ppm (at) [90 to 110 ppm (wt)]

证据片段: no large carbides have been observed, either on the fracture faces of test specimens or in the metallographic examination of samples from finished tubes
